snippet: An S.E.C. filing that appears to have been a fake bid for the cosmetics company raises questions about the potential for market manipulation.
abstract: Fraudulent bid to acquire Avon Products reveals security flaws at the Securities and Exchange Commission; agency reported regulatory filing that included bid by bogus firm PTG Capital Partners, sending shares of Avon up dramatically in roughly $91 million worth of trading; remains unclear whether market manipulation was goal of fraud, but incident raises serious questions about vulnerability of SEC's database.

byline.original: By MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN and DAVID GELLES
byline.contributor: Chad Bray and Ben Protess contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: An S.E.C. filing that appears to have been a fake bid for the cosmetics company raises questions about the potential for market manipulation.

headline.main: A Phantom Offer Sends Avon’s Shares Surging
headline.print_headline: Bid for Avon Reveals Hole at the S.E.C.
